movie_title: The Beginning of Everything -- The Big Bang
introduction:
How did everything get started? 

Has the universe a beginning or was it here since forever? Well, e

vocabulary.definition: an object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical interest
vocabulary.example: The museum showcased ancient relics from the Roman Empire.

vocabulary.definition: a material composed of antiparticles, with particles having properties opposite to those of normal matter particles
vocabulary.example: Scientists study antimatter to understand its unique properties.

vocabulary.definition: a subatomic particle, such as a proton or neutron, that is composed of two or more quarks
vocabulary.example: Hadrons are essential components of atomic nuclei.

vocabulary.definition: an ionized gas consisting of positive ions and free electrons in proportions resulting in more or less no overall electric charge
vocabulary.example: Plasma is often referred to as the fourth state of matter.

vocabulary.definition: informal term to describe something that is shaky, unstable, or unpredictable
vocabulary.example: The results of the experiment were a bit wibbly-wobbly, making it hard to draw conclusions.

vocabulary.definition: to make or become united, uniform, or whole
vocabulary.example: The new theory aims to unify different branches of science into a cohesive framework.
